item.title: Influx of graffiti on Stockwell road SW9 mainly on street service boxes and Bus stops, 26th October
item.description:
I like to report an influx of graffiti along Stockwell Road SW9. The graffiti is visible on the street service boxes, walls and Bus stops. It essentially runs the length of Stockwell road going towards Stockwell tube station. Please can the graffiti be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike clustering by van drivers employed by lime, 26th October
item.description:
Continued clustering of Lime hire bikes left together on the pavement, reducing pedestrian space and access to the railings. Please request removal and prevent repeated mass parking in this area. Photo taken today for evidence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Offord Road, Barnsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Build up of flytipping, 26th October
item.description:
This is a blind spot on Staffordshire st which is a fly tipping hotspot. Have asked the council to do more re inforcement. You can see here the build up day by day. As soon as it is cleared more arrives. It’s like living at the tip. If the council continues to refuse to put up a camera they need to schedule daily removal

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 153, Peckham High Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike Lanes., 26th October
item.description:
These cause an absolute nuisance to the surrounding roads (Howarth Road, Rochdale Road, etc). These were installed back in 2020, and has been a issue since. It forces all traffic to the Mcleod Road/Basildon Road junction (where the Cheers shop is located) and then having to go down the narrow side roads (the ones I mentioned earlier), which causes the traffic levels on these roads to increase! It gets particularly bad when delivery lorries have to get through as sometimes they are way too big! Ontop of this, some people do not know how to drive at that junction. These cycle lanes are hardly used and are honestly a waste of space, they really do need to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blithdale Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
